leaflet.constituency: Peterborough and Peakirk, Eye, Thorney & Newborough

messages.title: Why local residents in Peterborough are backing Stewart Jackson
messages.content: Stewart Jackson has been elected as the MP for Peterborough since 2005, when against the trend, he won the seat from Labour. He's been the MP for the past twelve years. Stewart lives in the constituency with his family in central Peterborough. As an MP, he works very hard for his constituents and has fought for the interests of the residents of Peterborough locally and in Parliament.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Housing, education, immigration, health and City Council services
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Over the years, Stewart has supported tens of thousands of residents with local and national problems.

issues.education: Over the years, Stewart has supported tens of thousands of residents with local and national problems relating to housing, education.
issues.health: Over the years, Stewart has supported tens of thousands of residents with local and national problems relating to health.
issues.immigration: Over the years, Stewart has supported tens of thousands of residents with local and national problems relating to immigration.

community.content: Over the years, Stewart has supported tens of thousands of residents with local and national problems relating to housing.

endorsements.endorsement: I've raised a number of issues with Stewart over the years and he has always replied promptly to try and help in any way that he can. He's been a great constituency MP for people who've needed help and I'll be voting for him!

Stewart was fundamental in stopping plans to desecrate the Eye, Thorney & Newborough ward with an energy park over local farmers' fields. The area would have been blighted if Stewart had not intervened.

I was a local UKIP candidate last year but I've always been impressed with Stewart's stance on the EU and his work at improving local education quality in Peterborough. I'm backing him wholeheartedly.

examples: Stewart Jackson has been elected as the MP for Peterborough since 2005.
Stewart lives in the constituency with his family in central Peterborough.
Stewart has supported tens of thousands of residents with local and national problems relating to housing, education, immigration, health and City Council services.
